D1.label: Hard Market Sustains COR <94%
D1.description: Commercial insurance pricing remains above loss cost trends; QBE sustains COR below 94% and re-rates as a consistently profitable insurer
D1.plain_english: This is the bull case — QBE's FY25 underwriting beat is structural, not cyclical. Hard market pricing holds and investment income continues at elevated levels.
D1.what_to_watch: 1H FY26 COR update and commercial insurance pricing surveys (CIAB, Aon).
D1.upside: Re-rating toward 14-15x P/E if COR sustains below 93% for FY26.
D1.risk_plain: If a severe cat season or cycle turn pushes COR above 97%, this narrative collapses.

D2.label: Investment Portfolio Outperforms
D2.description: US$28.9B portfolio generates 4.9%+ returns; structurally elevated rates provide durable investment income tailwind
D2.plain_english: Higher-for-longer US rates are a structural benefit to QBE's bond portfolio. Investment income cushions underwriting volatility.
D2.what_to_watch: US Federal Reserve rate decisions and portfolio yield disclosures in ASX updates.
D2.upside: Investment income sustains above US$1.5B pa, supporting EPS growth independent of underwriting.
D2.risk_plain: If the Fed cuts rates aggressively, reinvestment yields decline and this contribution fades.

D3.label: Catastrophe Season Overwhelms Rate Gains
D3.description: Above-budget natural catastrophe losses drive COR above 97%, eliminating underwriting profit and eroding investment income buffer
D3.plain_english: This is the key tail risk — a severe North Atlantic hurricane season or multiple secondary perils above budget forces QBE to report a poor year despite the hard market.
D3.what_to_watch: North Atlantic hurricane season (June-November 2026); QBE cat loss updates.
D3.risk_plain: Cat losses above US$1B net would push FY26 COR toward 97-100%, severely de-rating the stock.

D4.label: Premium Cycle Reversal / North America Deteriorates
D4.description: Global insurance market softens faster than expected; new capital erodes pricing discipline; North America COR returns above 100%
D4.plain_english: This is the structural bear case — insurance cycles always revert, and QBE's North America has a history of being the problem segment.
D4.what_to_watch: Commercial insurance pricing surveys turning negative; North America segment COR in next results.
D4.risk_plain: If the cycle turns and North America deteriorates simultaneously, QBE could revert to its pre-2022 earnings profile.

big_picture: QBE Insurance Group (ASX: QBE) — FY25 results beat: COR 91.9% vs 93-95% guidance, NPAT US$2,157M (+21%), DPS +25%. Hard market and elevated investment income sustain the bull case at 12x P/E.
